analyzed: bcu gnyis ni 'brel pa'o //

analyzed: sngags kyi don to //

original: rtogs pa la rtog pa thams cad spangs shing don dam par kun rdzob tu lha'i sku sgyu mar snang ba las /🔽dbyings de las yon tan zad mi shes pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bas na chos te /
analyzed: rtogs pa la rtog pa thams cad spangs shing don dam par kun rdzob tu lha'i sku sgyu mar snang ba las / dbyings de las yon tan zad mi shes pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bas na chos te /
translated: In terms of realization, all thoughts are abandoned and ultimately, the deity’s form appears as an illusion.🔽Since inexhaustible qualities arise from that dhātu, it is the “Dharma.”

original: dbyings de las yon tan zad mi shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyings de las yon tan zad mi shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since inexhaustible qualities arise from that dhātu,

original: de lta bas na de ci'i phyir zhe na zad mi shes she na /
analyzed: de lta bas na de ci'i phyir zhe na zad mi shes she na /
translated: why is it inexhaustible?

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan @33b zhing dpag tu med pas na bsod nams bsags pa'i phyir dang ye shes kyi chogs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan @33b zhing dpag tu med pas na bsod nams bsags pa'i phyir dang ye shes kyi chogs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is endowed with the accumulations of merit and wisdom and is immeasurable, it is inexhaustible because it accumulates merit and is endowed with the accumulation of wisdom.

original: 'o na des gzhan gyi rgyud ji ltar rig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na des gzhan gyi rgyud ji ltar rig ce na /
translated: Well, how does that know the mind of another?

original: shes rab kyis gtan la phab pa'am /🔽ye shes rang la shar te ji lta bar rtogs pas kun rdzob sgyu ma ltar snang zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyis gtan la phab pa'am / ye shes rang la shar te ji lta bar rtogs pas kun rdzob sgyu ma ltar snang zhing /
translated: It is ascertained by wisdom.🔽Since it arises in one’s wisdom, it is known by wisdom.

original: thugs rje ji snyed pa rig pa de ye shes las byung bas na ye shes ldan pa yod med shes so //
analyzed: thugs rje ji snyed pa rig pa de ye shes las byung bas na ye shes ldan pa yod med shes so //
translated: Since it arises from wisdom, it is endowed with wisdom.

original: de'i phyir de'i rgyur tshogs gnyis bstan pa'i phyir tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rgyur tshogs gnyis bstan pa'i phyir tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, in order to show the two collections as its cause, it is said, “arises from the accumulation of the two collections.”

original: 'o na ji ltar tshogs de nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar tshogs de nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But what is that collection?

original: rtag tu sbyin pa la dga' ba dang / khro ba las rgyal ba'i bzod ba dang / nyon mongs las rgyal zhing sems rnal du zhugs pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: rtag tu sbyin pa la dga' ba dang / khro ba las rgyal ba'i bzod ba dang / nyon mongs las rgyal zhing sems rnal du zhugs pa'i thabs te /
translated: It is the collection of generosity, which is always delighting in giving; of patience, which is conquering anger; and of means, which is conquering the afflictions and entering into the natural state of mind.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan zhing bsam pa brtan po'i brtson 'grus dang / dmigs bya la rtse gcig pa'i bsam gtan rnam par 'byed cing blo phul du phyin pa'i shes rab tshogs so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan zhing bsam pa brtan po'i brtson 'grus dang / dmigs bya la rtse gcig pa'i bsam gtan rnam par 'byed cing blo phul du phyin pa'i shes rab tshogs so //
translated: It is the collection of morality, which is steadfast effort; of concentration, which is one-pointedness of mind on the object of meditation; and of wisdom, which is the discernment and perfection of the mind.

original: gsang sngags kyi dbang du byas nas dus rtag tu kun rdzob la brten pa'i lha'i sku dang mi 'bral ba dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa la brten nas don dam par lhan cig skyes ba blo'i mchog bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi dbang du byas nas dus rtag tu kun rdzob la brten pa'i lha'i sku dang mi 'bral ba dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa la brten nas don dam par lhan cig skyes ba blo'i mchog bsgom pa'o //
translated: From the perspective of the secret mantra, it is the collection of never being separate from the deity’s form that is based on the conventional, and of cultivating the supreme mind of connate [union] on the ultimate level, based on the stage of completion.

original: 'o na yid mi g-yo zhing so so rang gis rig pa las 'bras bu ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yid mi g-yo zhing so so rang gis rig pa las 'bras bu ci zhe na /
translated: If the mind does not move, and is self-aware, what is its result?

original: mchog gi 'bras bu sku gsum dang ngo bo nyid kyi sku 'byung ste /
analyzed: mchog gi 'bras bu sku gsum dang ngo bo nyid kyi sku 'byung ste /
translated: The supreme result is the three bodies and the essence body.

original: de la chos kyi dbang phyug nas thams cad spangs zhes pa'i mthar snang ba mtha' yas la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbang phyug nas thams cad spangs zhes pa'i mthar snang ba mtha' yas la bstod pa'o //
translated: In this regard, from “Lord of Dharma” to “abandon all” is praise of Amitābha.

original: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba nas bsod nams ldan pa zhes bya bas rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sgo nas bstod /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba nas bsod nams ldan pa zhes bya bas rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sgo nas bstod /
translated: From “non-conceptual” to “possessing merit” is praise from the perspective of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: ye shes 'ba' zhig nas sku gsum 'chang zhes bya ba ni ye shes sems dpa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes 'ba' zhig nas sku gsum 'chang zhes bya ba ni ye shes sems dpa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: From “pure pristine consciousness” to “holder of the three bodies” is praise from the perspective of the jñānasattva.

original: dga' bar mdzad dang chu yi lha //
analyzed: dga' bar mdzad dang chu yi lha //
translated: The one who delights, the water god,

original: yon tan lag dang glang po'i spos //
analyzed: yon tan lag dang glang po'i spos //
translated: the one with the quality hand, the elephant’s powder,

original: zla ba dang ni zla bar grags //
analyzed: zla ba dang ni zla bar grags //
translated: the moon, and the one renowned as the moon,🔽the elephant’s strength, the crest jewel,

original: glang chen stobs dang nor bu'i gtsug / drag po dang ni seng ge mchod //
analyzed: glang chen stobs dang nor bu'i gtsug / drag po dang ni seng ge mchod //
translated: the one worshipped by Rudra and the lion,

original: ngang pa'i 'gros dang don rnams rgyal //
analyzed: ngang pa'i 'gros dang don rnams rgyal //
translated: the gait of the goose, the victor over objects,

original: shes rab brtsegs dang legs par gnas //
analyzed: shes rab brtsegs dang legs par gnas //
translated: the one with the name of Prajñākūṭa, and the one who abides well,

original: bdud rtsi shes dang lus bzang po //
analyzed: bdud rtsi shes dang lus bzang po //
translated: Amṛta, and Suśarīra,

original: ye shes ldan dang 'od 'phro ba //
analyzed: ye shes ldan dang 'od 'phro ba //
translated: Jñānin, Arka,

original: dka' thub gnas dang bkra shis 'byung //
analyzed: dka' thub gnas dang bkra shis 'byung //
translated: Tapaśrita, and Maṅgalākara,🔽Satya, Padma, and Nṛvāhana,

original: bden par smra dang padma dang // mi yi theg dang bde ba'i phyag / ye shes blo dang blo dri bral //
analyzed: bden par smra dang padma dang // mi yi theg dang bde ba'i phyag / ye shes blo dang blo dri bral //
translated: Sukapā, Jñānamati, and Vimalamati,

original: tshangs sbyin dang ni rin chen mdzod //
analyzed: tshangs sbyin dang ni rin chen mdzod //
translated: Brahmādāna, and Ratnākara,

original: me tog lha dang @34a * //
analyzed: me tog lha dang @34a * //
translated: Puṣpā,

original: legs bsam don //
analyzed: legs bsam don //
translated: and Sumatī,

original: dbang phyug che dang blo gros grags //
analyzed: dbang phyug che dang blo gros grags //
translated: Maheśvara, and Yaśomati,

original: rnam par rol dang shes pa'i mchog /'od zer tshogs dang rin chen snying //
analyzed: rnam par rol dang shes pa'i mchog /'od zer tshogs dang rin chen snying //
translated: Vikrīḍita, Jñānavara, and Raśmisthira,

original: grong khyer mthong dang zla ba tshes //
analyzed: grong khyer mthong dang zla ba tshes //
translated: Ratnagarbha, and Nāgarāja,

original: yid kyi yul dang yon tan grags //🔽zla ba'i bsil dang gsal ba dang // seng ge'i mdog dang lugs las bzlog / snying po dpal dang dngos mthar ston //
analyzed: yid kyi yul dang yon tan grags // zla ba'i bsil dang gsal ba dang // seng ge'i mdog dang lugs las bzlog / snying po dpal dang dngos mthar ston //
translated: Candrābha, and Guṇakīrti,🔽Candracūḍa, and Pradyota,🔽Siṃhavarṇa, and Anuloma,

original: glog gi 'od dang seng sbyin pa //
analyzed: glog gi 'od dang seng sbyin pa //
translated: Garbhāśraya, and Vidyuddeva,🔽Siṃhadatta, and Aparājita,

original: gzhan gyis mi thub rgyal ba'i tog / rab grub grags dang brtson 'grus brtan //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub rgyal ba'i tog / rab grub grags dang brtson 'grus brtan //
translated: Jayamati, and Siddhakīrti, and Dṛḍhavīrya,

original: dpe bral shin tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: dpe bral shin tu grags pa'o //
translated: It is incomparable and very famous.🔽The first Buddha body is the form body.🔽The essence body, though dwelling in cyclic existence by way of light, is not sullied by the faults of afflictions, like a lotus.

original: gzugs sku dang po'i sangs rgyas dang // ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni 'od kyi sgo nas 'khor bar bzhugs kyang nyon mongs ba'i skyon gyis ma gos pa'i phyir padma la de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyis rgyas par phye ste /
analyzed: gzugs sku dang po'i sangs rgyas dang // ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni 'od kyi sgo nas 'khor bar bzhugs kyang nyon mongs ba'i skyon gyis ma gos pa'i phyir padma la de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyis rgyas par phye ste /
translated: The light of the Tathagata opens it.

original: srid pa'i skye gnas 'gags te sra zhing mkhregs pa chos nyid kyi sku de yang zhal lnga sangs rgyas lnga'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi spyan dpral ba na re re yod pa thabs shes rab kyi 'od kyis bskyed pas na /
analyzed: srid pa'i skye gnas 'gags te sra zhing mkhregs pa chos nyid kyi sku de yang zhal lnga sangs rgyas lnga'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi spyan dpral ba na re re yod pa thabs shes rab kyi 'od kyis bskyed pas na /
translated: The birth places of cyclic existence are blocked. That essence body, which is hard and solid, has five faces, the nature of the five Buddhas. Each forehead has an eye of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po //
translated: It is the producer of all Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa'i mchog / ces pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa'i mchog / ces pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme son of the Buddhas.

original: nam mkha' las te stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' las te stong pa nyid do //
translated: From space, that is, from emptiness,

original: de las padma'i sbubs nas 'thon te rang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las padma'i sbubs nas 'thon te rang 'byung ba'o //
translated: it emerges from the center of a lotus. It is self-arisen.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i 'od chen gzhan gyi 'od zil gyis gnon pa ni dper na bskal pa'i me yis thams cad sreg cing 'od gzhan zil gyi sa gnon pas mun pa thams cad sel ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i 'od de yang thams cad
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i 'od chen gzhan gyi 'od zil gyis gnon pa ni dper na bskal pa'i me yis thams cad sreg cing 'od gzhan zil gyi sa gnon pas mun pa thams cad sel ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i 'od de yang thams cad
translated: The great light of the five Tathagatas, which outshines all other lights, is like the fire at the end of the aeon, which burns everything and outshines all other lights, dispelling all darkness.

original: la snang zhing nyan thos dang rangs sangs rgyas dang / lha'i 'od zil gyis gnon pa 'gro ba rnams smin par byed pa'i ye shes sgron ma lta bu'i sku gzi brjid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: la snang zhing nyan thos dang rangs sangs rgyas dang / lha'i 'od zil gyis gnon pa 'gro ba rnams smin par byed pa'i ye shes sgron ma lta bu'i sku gzi brjid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the light of the five Tathagatas shines on all, outshining the lights of the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, and gods, and has a body endowed with splendor like the lamp of the wisdom which ripens beings.

original: sangs rgyas sku lnga zhes pa nas shes pa srid 'byung zhes bya ba'i mthar dang po sangs rgyas la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku lnga zhes pa nas shes pa srid 'byung zhes bya ba'i mthar dang po sangs rgyas la bstod pa'o //
translated: The first praise of the Primordial Buddha, from The five bodies of the Buddha up to the knowledge which arises from existence.

original: chos las 'byung ste sgra snyan ma'o //
analyzed: chos las 'byung ste sgra snyan ma'o //
translated: The Dharma arises, the lute.

original: skyes ma thag tu 'gro ba'i bdag /
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu 'gro ba'i bdag /
translated: Immediately born, the lord of beings,

original: ces gar mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: ces gar mkhan ma'o //
translated: is the dancer.

original: nam mkha' rang 'byung zhes bya ba ni sgeg mo'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' rang 'byung zhes bya ba ni sgeg mo'o //
translated: The sky, self-arisen, is the flirtatious woman.

original: gcig pu sra mkhregs zhes bya ba ni phreng ba ma'o //
analyzed: gcig pu sra mkhregs zhes bya ba ni phreng ba ma'o //
translated: The one called “firm” is Mālikā.

original: nang gi lha mo rnams la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi lha mo rnams la bstod pa'o //
translated: This is the praise of the inner goddesses.

original: shes rab ye shes bdug pa ma //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes bdug pa ma //
translated: Wisdom-knowledge is Dhūmāṅgī,

original: 'od chen mdzes ma'i me tog ma //
analyzed: 'od chen mdzes ma'i me tog ma //
translated: great light is Puṣpāṅgī,

original: ye shes skar ma dri chab ma //
analyzed: ye shes skar ma dri chab ma //
translated: knowledge star is Candrāṅgī,

original: 'gro ba'i mar me @34b mar me ma'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mar me @34b mar me ma'o //
translated: and lamp of beings is Dīpāṅgī.

original: phyi'i lha mo rnams la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i lha mo rnams la bstod pa'o //
translated: This is the praise of the outer goddesses.

original: mar me che dang 'jig rten 'od //
analyzed: mar me che dang 'jig rten 'od //
translated: Great lamp, light of the world,

original: dpa' bo dri dang yon tan 'dzin //
analyzed: dpa' bo dri dang yon tan 'dzin //
translated: hero, holder of fragrance, and qualities,

original: mun pa bral dang seng ge spro //
analyzed: mun pa bral dang seng ge spro //
translated: free from darkness, lion-like,

original: rin chen grags dang zhi bar sbyin //
analyzed: rin chen grags dang zhi bar sbyin //
translated: jewel-renowned, and giving peace,

original: yid skyes zla dang legs par ston //
analyzed: yid skyes zla dang legs par ston //
translated: mind-born, moon, and excellent teacher,

original: ri bo rtse dang chos 'byung gnas //
analyzed: ri bo rtse dang chos 'byung gnas //
translated: mountain-peak, and source of Dharma,🔽definite meaning, Dharma-giver,

original: don rnams nges dang chos sbyin dang // rin chen gnas dang dbang po rgyal //
analyzed: don rnams nges dang chos sbyin dang // rin chen gnas dang dbang po rgyal //
translated: jewel-abode, and sense-conqueror,

original: seng ge mnan dang blo yi gnas //
analyzed: seng ge mnan dang blo yi gnas //
translated: lion-subduer, and abode of mind,

original: skal bral gdugs dang thams cad dpal //
analyzed: skal bral gdugs dang thams cad dpal //
translated: fortune-free, parasol, and glory of all,

original: seng ge'i sgra dang thams cad 'phags //
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra dang thams cad 'phags //
translated: lion's roar, and exalted of all,

original: klu yi 'od dang yon tan phreng //
analyzed: klu yi 'od dang yon tan phreng //
translated: serpent-light, and garland of qualities,

original: me tog ri dang dbyangs ldan don //
analyzed: me tog ri dang dbyangs ldan don //
translated: Flower Mountain and Melodious Meaning.

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas dang phyi nang gi lha mo rnams kyi mtshan no //
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas dang phyi nang gi lha mo rnams kyi mtshan no //
translated: The names of the primordial buddhas and the goddesses of the outer and inner [spheres].

original: de lta bus 'gro ba'i don byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin sgyu 'phrul dra ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bus 'gro ba'i don byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin sgyu 'phrul dra ba ste /
translated: The one who acts for the welfare of the world in that way is the net of illusions samādhi.

original: sngags mchog ces bya ba nas gsang sngags rgyal po zhes bya bas sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa gtso bo dang yum dang 'khor bstan to //
analyzed: sngags mchog ces bya ba nas gsang sngags rgyal po zhes bya bas sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa gtso bo dang yum dang 'khor bstan to //
translated: The one called the supreme mantra up to the one called the king of secret mantras teach the emanations of the net of illusions, the principal one, the consort, and the retinue.

original: don chen byed ni gdul bya dag pa'i don du bstan /
analyzed: don chen byed ni gdul bya dag pa'i don du bstan /
translated: The one who acts for great benefit is taught for the sake of pure trainees.

original: gtsug tor chen po ni dang po'i sangs rgyas nub pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor chen po ni dang po'i sangs rgyas nub pa'o //
translated: The great uṣṇīṣa is the setting of the primordial buddhas.

original: de la lha mo gsang ba'i yum bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la lha mo gsang ba'i yum bzhi'o //
translated: There are four secret consorts of the goddesses.

original: ngo mtshar ba yi bstod pa ni rmad du byung ngo //
analyzed: ngo mtshar ba yi bstod pa ni rmad du byung ngo //
translated: The praise of the amazing is the marvelous.

original: de nas nam mkha' la bcom ldan 'das seng ge'i steng nas 'od zer sna tshogs pa skye ba'i sku sna tshogs pa bstan pa sku'i mchog tu gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa 'gro ba kun dga' ba dang bde ba la dgod pa sna tshogs pa'i sems
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' la bcom ldan 'das seng ge'i steng nas 'od zer sna tshogs pa skye ba'i sku sna tshogs pa bstan pa sku'i mchog tu gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa 'gro ba kun dga' ba dang bde ba la dgod pa sna tshogs pa'i sems
translated: Then, in the sky, the Bhagavān, on a lion throne, displayed various bodies giving rise to various light rays. The Bhagavān Śākyamuni, who is supreme among bodies, delights all beings and causes them to enter into bliss.

original: can thams cad dad par byas nas byang chub tu sems bskyed par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: can thams cad dad par byas nas byang chub tu sems bskyed par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Having caused all sentient beings to have faith, he causes them to generate the mind of awakening.

original: 'khor khro bo drang srong khros pa lta bu gar gyi nyams dgu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'khor khro bo drang srong khros pa lta bu gar gyi nyams dgu dang ldan pa /
translated: The retinue is like wrathful sages, possessing the nine expressions of dance.

original: rigs gsum gyi bdag po /
analyzed: rigs gsum gyi bdag po /
translated: They are the lords of the three families.

original: gsang ba gsum gyi bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba gsum gyi bdag po /
translated: They are the lords of the three secrets.🔽In order to hold the secrets of all the gods and goddesses, they hold vajras.

original: lha dang lha mo thams cad kyi gsang ba 'dzin pa'i rtags su rdo rje 'dzin pa de'i nang nas gtso bo phyag na rdo rje'i lte ba la chos 'byung dang / rang 'byung gi mchod rten dang / gzhal yas khang gis ni chos mtshon /
analyzed: lha dang lha mo thams cad kyi gsang ba 'dzin pa'i rtags su rdo rje 'dzin pa de'i nang nas gtso bo phyag na rdo rje'i lte ba la chos 'byung dang / rang 'byung gi mchod rten dang / gzhal yas khang gis ni chos mtshon /
translated: Among them, the principal one is Vajrapāṇi. In his navel is a source of phenomena, a self-arisen stūpa, and a celestial mansion, which symbolize the Dharma.

original: lha'i rnam pas sangs rgyas /
analyzed: lha'i rnam pas sangs rgyas /
translated: The forms of the deities symbolize the Buddha.

original: mtshan gyis dge 'dun te /
analyzed: mtshan gyis dge 'dun te /
translated: The names symbolize the Saṅgha.

original: dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He upholds the Three Jewels.

original: des theg pa gsum ston pa po la zhus te /
analyzed: des theg pa gsum ston pa po la zhus te /
translated: He asks the teacher of the three vehicles.

original: des 'bras bu gsum bstan nas sems can theg pa gsum la dgod de /
analyzed: des 'bras bu gsum bstan nas sems can theg pa gsum la dgod de /
translated: He teaches the three results, and establishes sentient beings in the three vehicles.

original: 'bras bu don yod par byed pa'i ye shes pa zhags pa lta bus nyon mongs pa las rgyal bar byed //
analyzed: 'bras bu don yod par byed pa'i ye shes pa zhags pa lta bus nyon mongs pa las rgyal bar byed //
translated: The knowledge that makes the result meaningful is like a lasso that conquers the afflictions.

original: thugs rje'i zhags @35a * //
analyzed: thugs rje'i zhags @35a * //
translated: The lasso of compassion🔽comprehends sentient beings with afflictions, and it holds those who fall into error.

original: bas nyon mongs pa'i sems can sdud pa dang / log par ltung ba 'dzin pa dang / de yang rdo rje ltar dbyer med pa'i thugs rjes 'dzin cing shes rab kyi sdud par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bas nyon mongs pa'i sems can sdud pa dang / log par ltung ba 'dzin pa dang / de yang rdo rje ltar dbyer med pa'i thugs rjes 'dzin cing shes rab kyi sdud par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is held with the vajra-like indivisible compassion, and it is gathered with wisdom.

original: de ltar rang 'byung gi sku des dkyil 'khor bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang 'byung gi sku des dkyil 'khor bstan nas /

analyzed: yi ge drug pa nas sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog ni /

original: de la gsung 'di dang 'di sgrogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la gsung 'di dang 'di sgrogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, this speech is proclaimed.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu 'bebs pa zhags pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu 'bebs pa zhags pa'o //

original: mig brgya lcags sgrogs rdo rje dril bu'o //
analyzed: mig brgya lcags sgrogs rdo rje dril bu'o //

original: lus ni nas pags pa mkhregs zhes bya bas ni phyi'i lha mo bzhi la go rims bzhin du'o //
analyzed: lus ni nas pags pa mkhregs zhes bya bas ni phyi'i lha mo bzhi la go rims bzhin du'o //

original: rdo rje phreng thogs phreng ba ma //
analyzed: rdo rje phreng thogs phreng ba ma //
translated: The vajra garland is the garland-bearer.

original: dpal dang ldan ni sgeg mo ma'o //
analyzed: dpal dang ldan ni sgeg mo ma'o //
translated: The glorious one is the charm-bearer.

original: rdo rje rgyan nas nges par zhes bya bas go rims bzhin du gnyis la bstod do //
analyzed: rdo rje rgyan nas nges par zhes bya bas go rims bzhin du gnyis la bstod do //
translated: The vajra ornament is the banner-bearer, respectively.

original: yi ge drug pa byams pa ste //
analyzed: yi ge drug pa byams pa ste //
translated: The six-syllable mantra is Maitreya.

original: rdo rje sgra ni spos glang po //🔽'jam pa'i dbyangs te sgra chen ni //
analyzed: rdo rje sgra ni spos glang po // 'jam pa'i dbyangs te sgra chen ni //
translated: The vajra sound is the elephant.🔽The melodious one is Mañjuśrī.

original: ye shes tog ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes tog ces bya ba'o //
translated: The great sound is called the wisdom-peak.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya bzang skyong ste //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya bzang skyong ste //
translated: The world-holder is Bhadrapāla.

original: gsum ni blo gros rgya mtsho ste //
analyzed: gsum ni blo gros rgya mtsho ste //
translated: The three are Sāgaramati.

original: sgra gcig blo gros mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: sgra gcig blo gros mi zad pa'o //
translated: The one sound is Akṣayamati.

original: nam mkha'i zhes pa spobs brtsegs so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes pa spobs brtsegs so //
translated: The sky-holder is Pratibhānakūṭa.

original: mtha' klas zhes ba mthu chen thob //🔽sgra sgrogs zhes pa ngan song 'dren //
analyzed: mtha' klas zhes ba mthu chen thob // sgra sgrogs zhes pa ngan song 'dren //
translated: The one called Ananta is the one of great power.🔽The one called Ravanaruta is the one who leads from the lower realms.

original: sgra dang ldan pa mya ngan 'joms //
analyzed: sgra dang ldan pa mya ngan 'joms //
translated: The one called Svara is the one who conquers sorrow.

original: rnams kyis dra ba can la bstod //
analyzed: rnams kyis dra ba can la bstod //
translated: The one called Jalin is the one who is praised by the gods.

original: mchog ces zla 'od gzhon nu la //
analyzed: mchog ces zla 'od gzhon nu la //
translated: The one called Varada is the one who is the youthful moon.

original: brgyan pas 'od dpag med la bstod //
analyzed: brgyan pas 'od dpag med la bstod //
translated: The one called Alaṅkara is the one who is Amitābha.

original: gad rgyangs nam mkha'i mdzod la'o //
analyzed: gad rgyangs nam mkha'i mdzod la'o //
translated: The one called Hāsa is the one who is the sky treasury.🔽The one called Amṛta is the one with the hand of space.

original: bdud rtsi phyag dang nam mkha'i mdog / dra ba'i 'od 'phro mi shigs rnams //
analyzed: bdud rtsi phyag dang nam mkha'i mdog / dra ba'i 'od 'phro mi shigs rnams //

original: thugs rje zhags dang rin chen zhags //
analyzed: thugs rje zhags dang rin chen zhags //
translated: The one called Karuṇāśṛṅkha is the one who is the noose of compassion.🔽The one called Ratnaśṛṅkha is the one who is the noose of jewels.🔽The one called Padma­krodha is the one who is the wrathful lotus.

original: padma khros dang rdo rje khros //
analyzed: padma khros dang rdo rje khros //
translated: The one called Vajrakrodha is the one who is the wrathful vajra.

original: las kyi khros dang rin chen khros //
analyzed: las kyi khros dang rin chen khros //
translated: The one called Karmakrodha is the one who is the wrathful action.

original: 'bar ba'i 'od dang dbyug pa can //🔽'jam dpal khros dang dpa' bo che //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i 'od dang dbyug pa can // 'jam dpal khros dang dpa' bo che //
translated: The one called Jvālaprabha is the one who is the club-bearer.🔽The one called Mañjuśrīkrodha is the one who is the great hero.

original: gshin rje gshed dang brtul zhugs che //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed dang brtul zhugs che //
translated: The one called Yamāntaka is the one who is the great adept.

original: thabs chen rdzogs dang stobs po che //
analyzed: thabs chen rdzogs dang stobs po che //
translated: The one called Mahābala is the one who is the great power.

original: rgyud sde lnga bcu rtsa gsum las mtshan ni bdun cu rtsa lnga /
analyzed: rgyud sde lnga bcu rtsa gsum las mtshan ni bdun cu rtsa lnga /
translated: The fifty-seven names are from the fifty-three tantras.

original: rgyal ba lnga la bcu bzhi bcu bzhi thabs dang shes rab tshul du sgro'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba lnga la bcu bzhi bcu bzhi thabs dang shes rab tshul du sgro'o //
translated: The five Victors are each surrounded by fourteen, in the manner of means and insight.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rkang pa gcig ma tshang ste bcu'o /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rkang pa gcig ma tshang ste bcu'o /
translated: The verse has ten lines, one line less than a verse.

original: // / da ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi dkyil 'khor ni dbus snang ba mtha' yas dang / dang po'i sangs rgyas rtsa ba'i zhal dmar po //
analyzed: // / da ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi dkyil 'khor ni dbus snang ba mtha' yas dang / dang po'i sangs rgyas rtsa ba'i zhal dmar po //
translated: Now, in the mandala of Amitabha, Amitabha is in the center, and the root face of Adibuddha is red.

original: 'khor lo dmar po gzhan gong dang mthun /
analyzed: 'khor lo dmar po gzhan gong dang mthun /
translated: The other wheels are red, as above.

original: yang dag bdag med de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: yang dag bdag med de bzhin nyid //
translated: The reality of the true selflessness

original: ces bya bas zab pa bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya bas zab pa bstan to //
translated: is taught as the profound.

original: de yang smra ba dang brjod pa thams cad dang bal te yi ge med ce'o //
analyzed: de yang smra ba dang brjod pa thams cad dang bal te yi ge med ce'o //
translated: Moreover, it is free from all speech and expression, and is without syllables.

original: 'o na brjod pa dang bral na rtogs par nus sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na brjod pa dang bral na rtogs par nus sam zhe na /
translated: If so, is it possible to realize it if it is free from expression?

original: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog gis @37a * //
analyzed: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog gis @37a * //
translated: The supreme leader of the speakers of emptiness🔽is able to.

original: nus she'o // ji lta bas she na /
analyzed: nus she'o // ji lta bas she na /
translated: How is it?

original: rgya che bas zab mo ston to //
analyzed: rgya che bas zab mo ston to //
translated: The vast teaches the profound.

original: zab cing rgya che zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che zhes pa'o //
translated: It is profound and vast.

original: dper na byin rlabs las sgra byung ba bzhin du rang las so //
analyzed: dper na byin rlabs las sgra byung ba bzhin du rang las so //
translated: For example, like a sound arising from a blessing, it is from itself.

original: dung chen ni zab pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: dung chen ni zab pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The great conch is the example of the profound.

original: gand'i ni me long lta bu'i dpe'o //
analyzed: gand'i ni me long lta bu'i dpe'o //
translated: The bell is the example of the mirror-like wisdom.

original: rnga ni so sor rtog pa dang bya ba grub pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi dpe'o //
analyzed: rnga ni so sor rtog pa dang bya ba grub pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi dpe'o //
translated: The drum is the example of the wisdom of discrimination, of success in action, and of equality.

original: de ltar gong ma ni zab pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: de ltar gong ma ni zab pa'i dpe'o //
translated: Thus, the former is the example of the profound.

original: 'og mas rgya che ba'i dpe'o //
analyzed: 'og mas rgya che ba'i dpe'o //
translated: The latter is the example of the vast.

original: 'o na rgya che ba'i don ji ltar ston zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgya che ba'i don ji ltar ston zhe na /
translated: How does it teach the meaning of the vast?

original: gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa ste //
translated: The formless is the excellent form.

original: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las skyes te gzugs med pa dang / gzugs dang 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las skyes te gzugs med pa dang / gzugs dang 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: The formless is the form of the mind born of various forms, of various forms such as desire.

original: 'o na gcig du mar snang ba cang 'thad dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gcig du mar snang ba cang 'thad dam zhe na /
translated: But is it tenable that one appears as many?

original: yid las skyes pa dang snang ba du mar snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽thams cad du khyab pa'i gzugs khyad med ce na /
analyzed: yid las skyes pa dang snang ba du mar snang ba'i phyir ro // thams cad du khyab pa'i gzugs khyad med ce na /
translated: Because of the mind-born and the appearance of many appearances.🔽If it is objected that the form which pervades everything is undifferentiated,

original: gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba'i mtshungs pa med cing ste /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba'i mtshungs pa med cing ste /
translated: the incomparable bearer of all reflections,

original: 'dra ba med pa'i bcom ldan 'das ni che ba'i bdag nyid kyi sku du mas so //
analyzed: 'dra ba med pa'i bcom ldan 'das ni che ba'i bdag nyid kyi sku du mas so //
translated: the Lord, with his many bodies of greatness,

original: che ba'i bdag nyid kyi sku du mar gzhan gyis kyang nus so zhe na /
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid kyi sku du mar gzhan gyis kyang nus so zhe na /
translated: But it is possible that others also have a body of great power?

original: khams gsum dbang phyug dang chen po'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: khams gsum dbang phyug dang chen po'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: Because he is the lord of the three realms and the great self.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan ci zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan ci zhe na /

original: 'phags pa'i lam shin tu mtho la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam shin tu mtho la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is established in the very lofty path of the noble ones.

analyzed: de bas na thams cad 'jam dpal yin zhing gzugs med kyi khams dang / gzugs khams dang 'dod khams kyi bdag por gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, all are Mañjuśrī, the lord of the formless realm, the form realm, and the desire realm.

original: de yang thams cad la ste /
analyzed: de yang thams cad la ste /
translated: And that is for all.

original: zab mo mtshon te /
analyzed: zab mo mtshon te /
translated: Indicating the profound,

original: 'jig rten gyi de nyid shes shing legs pa'i lam ston pas ni slob dpon no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi de nyid shes shing legs pa'i lam ston pas ni slob dpon no //
translated: he is the master because he knows the truth of the world and teaches the good path.

analyzed: slob dpon des bstan pa'i yon tan ni 'jigs pa sel zhing mgon skyabs yid bde ba skyed pas na de la phyag dang bkur sti bya bar 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The virtue taught by that master is worthy of homage and respect because it dispels fear, is a protector, and produces mental happiness.

original: rgya chen pos don byed de nam mkha'i mtha' zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgya chen pos don byed de nam mkha'i mtha' zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The vast one acts for the purpose, called the end of space.

original: de yang zad mi shes pas ldan pas mtsho zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang zad mi shes pas ldan pas mtsho zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is endowed with inexhaustibility, it is called the ocean.

original: yang dag bdag med nas khyu mchog ces bya ba'i mthar padma rdo rje ma /
analyzed: yang dag bdag med nas khyu mchog ces bya ba'i mthar padma rdo rje ma /
translated: Again, from the true selflessness up to the bull, it is Padmavajra.

analyzed: zab cing nas dgra che'i mthar rin chen rdo rje ma'o //
translated: From the profound up to the great enemy, it is Ratnavajra.

analyzed: mi gnas nas dam pa'i mthar sems ma rdo rje ma'o //

analyzed: sna tshogs nas che bar grags kyi mthar las kyi rdo rje ma'o //
translated: From the various up to the greatly renowned, it is Karmavajra.

analyzed: khams gsum nas ye shes rgya mtsho'i mthar snang ba mtha' yas dbus @37b kyi gtso bo la bstod pa'o //
translated: From the three realms up to the ocean of pristine consciousness, it is Amitābha.🔽The praise of the principal one in the center is as follows:

original: yon tan 'od dang khyad par che //
analyzed: yon tan 'od dang khyad par che //
translated: Guṇaprabha, Mahāviśeṣa,

original: rnam shes grags dang kun du grags //
analyzed: rnam shes grags dang kun du grags //

analyzed: zla ba gang dang padma'i 'od // dka' thub rgyal dang mar me rgyal //
translated: Candra, Padmin,🔽Tapajit, Dīpajit,

original: glog gi tog dang rgyal ba'i 'od //
analyzed: glog gi tog dang rgyal ba'i 'od //

original: gsang ba ldan dang dpe bral grags //
analyzed: gsang ba ldan dang dpe bral grags //
translated: Guhyayukta, Niraupamyayaśas,

original: padma grags dang me tog mtshan //🔽spyan mchog bzang dang grags med don //
analyzed: padma grags dang me tog mtshan // spyan mchog bzang dang grags med don //
translated: Padmaśrī, Puṣpaketu,🔽Sumukha, Avyākṛtanaya,

original: drag po sde dang bsod nams 'od //
analyzed: drag po sde dang bsod nams 'od //
translated: Rudrasena, Puṇyaprabha,

original: khyad par can dang thogs med blo //
analyzed: khyad par can dang thogs med blo //
translated: Special, Unimpeded Intellect,

original: sgra gcan 'dzin dang ye shes 'od //
analyzed: sgra gcan 'dzin dang ye shes 'od //

original: grags ldan dang ni ye shes dbang //
analyzed: grags ldan dang ni ye shes dbang //

original: skar ma'i tog dang r'a hu la //
analyzed: skar ma'i tog dang r'a hu la //

original: sman chen po dang sman rgyal po //
analyzed: sman chen po dang sman rgyal po //

original: bsod nams glang po rgyu yi stobs //
analyzed: bsod nams glang po rgyu yi stobs //

original: skar ma rgyal dang rgyal ba'i sku //
analyzed: skar ma rgyal dang rgyal ba'i sku //
translated: Star King, Body of the Victorious One,

original: nyi 'od 'joms dang chos kyi mdzod //
analyzed: nyi 'od 'joms dang chos kyi mdzod //
translated: Destroyer of the Light of the Sun, Treasury of Dharma,

original: legs pa'i blo gros dang rgyal po //
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros dang rgyal po //
translated: Good Intellect, King,

original: rdo rje sde dang shes rab brtsegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sde dang shes rab brtsegs //

original: legs par bzhugs dang rgyal ba'i blo //
analyzed: legs par bzhugs dang rgyal ba'i blo //
translated: Well-Abiding, Victorious Intellect,

original: tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang klu yi dbang //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang klu yi dbang //

analyzed: yon tan gsal dang ye shes dag / tog gi 'od dang tshangs pa dge /'o na skyob pa ji ltar nus she na //

original: ye shes dbang bskur cod pan zhes pa nas //
analyzed: ye shes dbang bskur cod pan zhes pa nas //
translated: From Crown of the Empowerment of Wisdom up to

original: nyon mongs dri ma kun las 'das //
analyzed: nyon mongs dri ma kun las 'das //
translated: Transcending all afflictive stains,

original: zhes bya bas rang don spangs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas rang don spangs pa bstan to //

original: sa bcu la dbang bskur bas sdug bsngal zhi nas 'bras bu thob pa dang / shes bya dang nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: sa bcu la dbang bskur bas sdug bsngal zhi nas 'bras bu thob pa dang / shes bya dang nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The ten levels are the empowerment, the pacification of suffering, the attainment of the result, and the elimination of the obscurations of the knowable and of the afflictions.

analyzed: gzhan don ji ltar 'gro zhe na / nam mkha'i mtha' klas nas /
translated: How does one benefit others?🔽One is established on the path of space

original: nam mkha'i lam la rab tu gnas //🔽zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i lam la rab tu gnas // zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: that extends to the limits of the sky.

analyzed: gong 'og tu 'brel pa des ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sbubs nas grol ba dang 'khor ba las sgrol ba dus thams cad la sgrib pa med pa shes bya la thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The connection between the above and below indicates that one is liberated from the cocoon of the obscurations of the knowable, one is liberated from samsara, and one is unobstructed with respect to the knowable at all times.

original: des sems can kun gyi gtso bo'o //
analyzed: des sems can kun gyi gtso bo'o //
translated: One is the foremost of all sentient beings.

original: de la ni rang dang gzhan gyi yon tan mthar phyin pa lus med pa'i chos sku'o //
analyzed: de la ni rang dang gzhan gyi yon tan mthar phyin pa lus med pa'i chos sku'o //
translated: One has the body of the Dharma, which is the ultimate perfection of one's own and others' qualities and is devoid of physical form.

original: de la brten pa ni lus kyi mchog go //
analyzed: de la brten pa ni lus kyi mchog go //
translated: One has the supreme body that is based on that.

original: de mi 'gal lam zhe na /
analyzed: de mi 'gal lam zhe na /
translated: Is there not a contradiction here?

original: yid bzhin nor bu chen po 'chang //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu chen po 'chang //

original: zhes pa ste rtog pa dang bral kyang ston pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste rtog pa dang bral kyang ston pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: One is free from conceptualization, yet one is like a teacher.

analyzed: yang na yon tan gyi che ba'i khyad par chos sku dang gzugs sku gnyis go rims bzhin du bstan to //

analyzed: dbyings nam mkha' lta bu dang ye shes zad me shes pa las skye ba med kyang skye ba'i tshul ston to //
translated: Although it is born from the space-like dhātu and inexhaustible wisdom, it displays the way of birth.

analyzed: dang po ye shes chen pos ma rig pa sel ba dang / srid pa'i dra ba 'joms @38a * //
translated: First, with great wisdom, it dispels ignorance and burns the net of existence🔽with the fire of wisdom.

analyzed: pa'i shes rab kyi mes bsregs nas gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir des srid pa'i rgyun bcom nas rang don grub ste /
translated: Having destroyed the continuum of existence for the sake of pacifying the afflictions of others, it accomplishes one’s own benefit.

original: 'khor ba rgya mtsho'i 'dam nas pha rol tu phyin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba rgya mtsho'i 'dam nas pha rol tu phyin te /
translated: Having crossed to the other side of the swamp of saṃsāra,

original: gzhan don thugs rje dang ldan te /🔽mi nub pa'i dbang bskur nas rang gi sdug bsngal zhi zhing /
analyzed: gzhan don thugs rje dang ldan te / mi nub pa'i dbang bskur nas rang gi sdug bsngal zhi zhing /

original: 'o na nus pa cis she na /

original: dpag bsam zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //

original: de yang bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes te /
analyzed: de yang bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes te /

original: dus shes shing dbang po shes pa'o //
analyzed: dus shes shing dbang po shes pa'o //

original: yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan zhing sems can sdug bsngal can dbugs 'byin par byed cing bde ba la 'god pa de la ni bkur sti dang mchod bas skyabs su 'os pa'i phyir ro //

original: de yang tshul khrims gtsang zhing dam par gyur pa nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'bras bu la rim gyis brod pa bskyed nas mthar legs par mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad sel ba ni 'di kho na ste /

original: gzhan mthun / de la snying rjes don sgrub pa dang / shes rab bo //
analyzed: gzhan mthun / de la snying rjes don sgrub pa dang / shes rab bo //
translated: There are two: accomplishing the purpose with compassion and wisdom.

original: dam pa'i gang zag gi sems can ji ltar bde ba thob par 'dod pas don bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: dam pa'i gang zag gi sems can ji ltar bde ba thob par 'dod pas don bsgrub par bya /
translated: Since one desires to attain the happiness of sentient beings, the sublime person should accomplish the purpose.

original: de ni ngan song sbyong bar byed pa'i mgon po grol bar byed pa'i thabs ston pa ni nyon mongs pa bsal ba dang / mi shes pa bsal ba'i phyir nga rgyal can de 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med bsal bar mi nus she na /
analyzed: de ni ngan song sbyong bar byed pa'i mgon po grol bar byed pa'i thabs ston pa ni nyon mongs pa bsal ba dang / mi shes pa bsal ba'i phyir nga rgyal can de 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med bsal bar mi nus she na /
translated: Since one desires to clear away the afflictions and to clear away ignorance, that arrogant one is unable to clear away desire, form, and formlessness.

original: nga rgyal can 'dul ba ni rgyu shes rab dang snying rjes sku che ba'i bdag nyid du ston pa ni dpal ldan zhes bya ba nas tshangs pa'i yul sa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: nga rgyal can 'dul ba ni rgyu shes rab dang snying rjes sku che ba'i bdag nyid du ston pa ni dpal ldan zhes bya ba nas tshangs pa'i yul sa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The subduing of the proud is shown by the greatness of his body through the cause of wisdom and compassion, as indicated by the words “glorious” up to “the realm of Brahma.”

original: phyag rgya 'khor lo dang shak ti 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'khor lo dang shak ti 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The mudra is the wheel and the sword.

original: don ston pa ni don gcig ces bya bas so //
analyzed: don ston pa ni don gcig ces bya bas so //
translated: The teaching of the meaning is indicated by the words “one meaning.”

original: 'o na 'jigs pa chen po ston pa des rtogs mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'jigs pa chen po ston pa des rtogs mi nus so zhe na /
translated: But if one says that one cannot understand through the teaching of the great fear,

original: 'jigs pa med par ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med par ro //
translated: it is said that “there is no fear.”

original: de ltar zil gyis mnan nas stong pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: de ltar zil gyis mnan nas stong pa nyid ston te /
translated: Thus, having overwhelmed, he teaches emptiness.

original: ming bzhi las rten med pa la ni ming bzhi'i phung po bstan nas theg pa la dgod pa ni rnam par rig pa'i gzugs su'o //
analyzed: ming bzhi las rten med pa la ni ming bzhi'i phung po bstan nas theg pa la dgod pa ni rnam par rig pa'i gzugs su'o //
translated: Having taught the four name aggregates in the absence of a basis, he establishes them in the vehicle through the form of consciousness.

original: don ston pa ni don zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: don ston pa ni don zhes pa'o ;
translated: The teaching of the meaning is indicated by the words “meaning.”

original: / gdul bya ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: / gdul bya ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The disciples are the various forms.

original: 'dod pa'i nas grol bar byed ces pa'i mthar sems dpa' bzhi la go rims bzhin /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nas grol bar byed ces pa'i mthar sems dpa' bzhi la go rims bzhin /
translated: At the end of “liberating from desire,” the four bodhisattvas are in order.

original: nyon mongs nas gzugs 'chang mthar rin chen rigs kyi sems dpa' bzhi'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs nas gzugs 'chang mthar rin chen rigs kyi sems dpa' bzhi'o //
translated: From the afflictions to the bearer of form, the four are the bodhisattvas of the jewel family.

original: lag pa brgya po nas gar byed ces pa'i @41b mthar padma'i sems dpa' bzhi'o //
analyzed: lag pa brgya po nas gar byed ces pa'i @41b mthar padma'i sems dpa' bzhi'o //
translated: From the one with a hundred hands to the one who dances, the four are the lotus bodhisattvas.

original: sa yi dkyil 'khor nas gnon zhes pa'i mthar rdo rje rigs kyi sems dpa' bzhi la bstod /
analyzed: sa yi dkyil 'khor nas gnon zhes pa'i mthar rdo rje rigs kyi sems dpa' bzhi la bstod /
translated: From the earth mandala to the one who presses down, the four are the vajra family bodhisattvas.

original: don gcig gnyis med nas rgyud dang ldan zhes pa'i mthar sgo ba bzhi la go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: don gcig gnyis med nas rgyud dang ldan zhes pa'i mthar sgo ba bzhi la go rims bzhin no //
translated: From the single meaning to the one endowed with tantra, the four are the gatekeepers in order.

original: don grub dpal dang ye shes nyi //🔽don yod grub dang ri rab brtsegs //
analyzed: don grub dpal dang ye shes nyi // don yod grub dang ri rab brtsegs //
translated: Siddhārtha, Śrījñāna,🔽Amoghasiddhi, Merukūṭa,

original: sgra sbyin dang ni padma dpal //🔽dgra bcom grags dang ye shes stobs //
analyzed: sgra sbyin dang ni padma dpal // dgra bcom grags dang ye shes stobs //
translated: Gandharva, Padmaśrī,🔽Arhatkīrti, Jñānabala,

original: nyon mongs 'joms dang ye shes don //
analyzed: nyon mongs 'joms dang ye shes don //
translated: Klesajit, Jñānartha,

original: bde ba'i dri dang dpe bral bzhad //🔽dri yi 'od dang mtha' yas ston //
analyzed: bde ba'i dri dang dpe bral bzhad // dri yi 'od dang mtha' yas ston //
translated: Sukhaspṛṣṭa, Vimala, Hāsa,🔽Gandhābha, Anantamukha,

original: so ma dang ni ratna so //🔽seng ge mchog dang bsam gtan 'od //
analyzed: so ma dang ni ratna so // seng ge mchog dang bsam gtan 'od //
translated: Saumya, Ratnasambhava,🔽Siṃhaghoṣa, Dhyānarāja,

original: dpa' bar 'gro dad rnam par rol //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro dad rnam par rol //
translated: Śūrapāṇi, Vikrānta,

original: rin chen yon tan don ston pa'o //
analyzed: rin chen yon tan don ston pa'o //
translated: Ratnākara, Guṇārtha,

original: da ni 'dod chags kyi don du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni 'dod chags kyi don du bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, the teaching for the sake of desire is as follows.

original: dngos don ma lus te chags pa can la /
analyzed: dngos don ma lus te chags pa can la /
translated: The one who has all the real things, for the one who is attached,

original: stong pa nyid dga' 'dod chags blo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dga' 'dod chags blo //
translated: is the one who delights in emptiness, the mind of desire.

original: des 'dul ba'i sku ston pa ni srid pa'i 'dod chags spangs pas ston te /
analyzed: des 'dul ba'i sku ston pa ni srid pa'i 'dod chags spangs pas ston te /
translated: The one who is tamed by that, the one who is taught the body, is the one who is taught by abandoning the desire of existence.

original: mdog dang dbyibs dang rgyan dang spyod pa la sogs pas yid tshim pa bskyed nas lam la 'god do //
analyzed: mdog dang dbyibs dang rgyan dang spyod pa la sogs pas yid tshim pa bskyed nas lam la 'god do //
translated: Having generated the satisfaction of the mind with color, shape, ornaments, conduct, and so on, one is placed on the path.

original: dngos don gyis ni rin chen sems ma'o //
analyzed: dngos don gyis ni rin chen sems ma'o //
translated: The one who has all the real things is the precious mind.

original: stong pa nyid dga' nas spangs pas ni zhes bya bas padma'i sems ma dang las kyi sems ma la bstod /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dga' nas spangs pas ni zhes bya bas padma'i sems ma dang las kyi sems ma la bstod /
translated: The one who delights in emptiness, the one who is abandoned by that, praises the lotus mind and the karma mind.

original: srid gsum zhes bya bas sems ma rdo rje ma la bstod /
analyzed: srid gsum zhes bya bas sems ma rdo rje ma la bstod /
translated: The one who is in the three worlds praises the mind-vajra woman.

original: sprin dkar dag pa nas sprul pa'i rgyan dang ldan zhes pa'i mthar ye shes sems dpa' la bstod /
analyzed: sprin dkar dag pa nas sprul pa'i rgyan dang ldan zhes pa'i mthar ye shes sems dpa' la bstod /
translated: The one who is like a white cloud, the one who is endowed with emanated ornaments, praises the gnosis being.

original: dgra bcom grags dang rin chen 'od //
analyzed: dgra bcom grags dang rin chen 'od //
translated: The one who is the fame of the arhats, the one who is the light of jewels,

original: srid bcings grol dang spyod ngan spangs //
analyzed: srid bcings grol dang spyod ngan spangs //
translated: the one who is bound in existence, the one who is liberated, the one who abandons bad conduct,

original: nam mkha'i mdzod dang spobs pa grags //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mdzod dang spobs pa grags //
translated: the one who is the sky treasury, the one who is the fame of courage,

original: rdo rje nor bu tshe dpag med ;
analyzed: rdo rje nor bu tshe dpag med ;
translated: Vajra Jewel, Amitayus,🔽Jewel Array, Jewel,

original: / nor bu bkod dang rin chen dang // yon tan mgon dang ri bo grags //
analyzed: / nor bu bkod dang rin chen dang // yon tan mgon dang ri bo grags //
translated: Lord of Qualities, Mountain Fame,

original: bcu 'od ldan dang gnyid dang bral //
analyzed: bcu 'od ldan dang gnyid dang bral //
translated: Ten, Radiant, Free from Sleep,

original: klu stobs shin tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: klu stobs shin tu grags pa'o //
translated: Powerful Naga, Very Famous.

original: gti mug can la de nyid dran pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan ni chos sku dang gzugs sku'o //
analyzed: gti mug can la de nyid dran pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan ni chos sku dang gzugs sku'o //
translated: For the ignorant, mindfulness of reality is the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, and so on. The qualities of the Tathagata are the Dharma body and the form body.

original: chags pa can 'dul ba ni nam mkha' ltar ma chags pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa can 'dul ba ni nam mkha' ltar ma chags pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: For those to be tamed with attachment, meditation on non-attachment like space is taught.

original: da ni shes rab bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni shes rab bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach wisdom,

original: ril por 'dzin pa dgag pa'i phyir dang / zhen pa spang ba'i phyir phung po lnga stong pa nyid du bstan /🔽de yang nges @42a * //
analyzed: ril por 'dzin pa dgag pa'i phyir dang / zhen pa spang ba'i phyir phung po lnga stong pa nyid du bstan / de yang nges @42a * //
translated: in order to refute grasping as a whole and to abandon clinging, the five aggregates are taught as emptiness.

original: par 'dzin pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: par 'dzin pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, this is the abandonment of grasping as real.

original: des don dam med kyang sdom pa'i rten kun rdzob du bstan pa 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des don dam med kyang sdom pa'i rten kun rdzob du bstan pa 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: By that, although ultimately non-existent, the conventional basis of the vows is taught as tenable.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya bas rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bstan /
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya bas rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bstan /
translated: The twelve factors indicate the path of the pratyekabuddha.

original: bden ba bzhi ni ston pa po //
analyzed: bden ba bzhi ni ston pa po //
translated: The four truths are taught by the teacher

original: zhes bya bas nyan thos kyis rtogs pa'i lam mo ;
analyzed: zhes bya bas nyan thos kyis rtogs pa'i lam mo ;
translated: indicates the path of realization of the śrāvakas.

original: / bden pa bzhi zhes bya ba nas rnam pa nyi shus zhes bya bas rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos las khyad par ston pa ni skad cig ma'am stong pa nyi shus khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: / bden pa bzhi zhes bya ba nas rnam pa nyi shus zhes bya bas rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos las khyad par ston pa ni skad cig ma'am stong pa nyi shus khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: The four truths, etc., up to twenty aspects indicates the distinction from the pratyekabuddhas and śrāvakas.

original: 'o na de'i 'bras bu ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i 'bras bu ci zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: byang chub pa ni chos sku rnam par sangs rgyas pa ni longs sku sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa ste 'bras bu de'o //
analyzed: byang chub pa ni chos sku rnam par sangs rgyas pa ni longs sku sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa ste 'bras bu de'o //
translated: Enlightenment is the dharmakāya, complete buddhahood is the saṃbhogakāya, and the emanations of the Buddha are the nirmāṇakāya. Those are the results.

original: de'i phyir theg pa ni 'di'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa ni 'di'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the vehicle.

original: 'o na 'bras bu sku gsum theg pa 'dis grub pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu sku gsum theg pa 'dis grub pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Well, why is the result, the three bodies, accomplished by this vehicle?

original: nyon mongs khams rnams dag par byed pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa zad par byed pa'i phyir na 'khor ba'i dri ma spangs shing 'jigs su rung pa'i gnas las grol bar byed pa'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spong ba ni 'di yin pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs khams rnams dag par byed pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa zad par byed pa'i phyir na 'khor ba'i dri ma spangs shing 'jigs su rung pa'i gnas las grol bar byed pa'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spong ba ni 'di yin pas so //
translated: Because it purifies the elements of affliction and eliminates the obscurations of karma, it is the relinquishment of the stains of cyclic existence and the relinquishment of the obscurations together with their imprints that free one from the terrifying states.

original: de'i phyir snying rje chen po shes rab thabs dang ldan nas don yod cing 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan no //
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje chen po shes rab thabs dang ldan nas don yod cing 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan no //
translated: Therefore, great compassion, endowed with wisdom and method, is meaningful and bears the fruit of benefiting migrating beings.

original: 'o na rang zhen pa dang ldan pa lta bu snying rje skyed pa byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang zhen pa dang ldan pa lta bu snying rje skyed pa byed dam zhe na /
translated: Well then, is it like the compassion of one who is attached?

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not like that.

original: rtog pa thams cad spangs shing rnam par shes pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas yad du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba'i rtog pa spangs te /
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad spangs shing rnam par shes pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas yad du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba'i rtog pa spangs te /
translated: Having abandoned all concepts, it follows after consciousness and abandons the concepts of what is pleasant and unpleasant.

original: rtog pa med pa'i ye shes ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa rig pas sems can thams cad kyi rgyud rig cing bsam pa ji lta ba ste /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i ye shes ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa rig pas sems can thams cad kyi rgyud rig cing bsam pa ji lta ba ste /
translated: Since nonconceptual wisdom knows the way things are and the multiplicity of things, it knows the mindstreams of all sentient beings and their individual thoughts.

original: de yang rim dang rim ma yin pa'i tshul gyis theg pa chen po'i lam la 'god de /
analyzed: de yang rim dang rim ma yin pa'i tshul gyis theg pa chen po'i lam la 'god de /
translated: Moreover, they are established in the Mahayana path, in a gradual or non-gradual manner.

original: phyin ci log dang nor pa spangs nas phyin ci ma log pa'i 'bras bu chos sku longs sku ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang nor pa spangs nas phyin ci ma log pa'i 'bras bu chos sku longs sku ste /
translated: Having abandoned error and delusion, they attain the unmistaken result, the dharmakaya and the sambhogakaya,

original: rang don gzhan don dang ldan pa thob par byed do //
analyzed: rang don gzhan don dang ldan pa thob par byed do //
translated: endowed with benefit for oneself and benefit for others.

original: de ltar shes pas 'bras bu sku gsum thob par ston to //
analyzed: de ltar shes pas 'bras bu sku gsum thob par ston to //
translated: Thus, it is taught that by knowing that, one attains the result, the three kayas.

original: 'o na 'bras bu de thob pa'i 'khrul pa de ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu de thob pa'i 'khrul pa de ci zhe na /
translated: Well, what is the delusion of attaining that result?

original: grangs can la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is the Samkhyas and so forth,

original: dngos po kun yon tan gsum du 'dod pa dang / bdag la sogs pa 'dod pa dang / gzhan yang bye brag pa la sogs pa phung po lnga'i skye mched kyi rdzas don dam par 'dod cing dus gsum rdzas su 'dod pa de @42b dag ni mi 'thad do /
analyzed: dngos po kun yon tan gsum du 'dod pa dang / bdag la sogs pa 'dod pa dang / gzhan yang bye brag pa la sogs pa phung po lnga'i skye mched kyi rdzas don dam par 'dod cing dus gsum rdzas su 'dod pa de @42b dag ni mi 'thad do /
translated: who assert that all things are the three gunas, who assert the self and so forth, and who further assert that the substances of the five aggregates are ultimate and that the three times are substantial.

original: glog dang me lce bzhin du thams cad skad cig mar bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glog dang me lce bzhin du thams cad skad cig mar bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not tenable, because like lightning and a flame, all things are not distinguished as momentary.

original: 'o na thams cad skad cig mar song nas 'bad pa don med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na thams cad skad cig mar song nas 'bad pa don med do zhe na /
translated: Well, if everything is reduced to a moment, then effort is pointless.

original: khyed kyi rdzas su 'dod pa rtag pa la mi 'thad de 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed kyi rdzas su 'dod pa rtag pa la mi 'thad de 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable for you to assert that a permanent substance is a moment, because it is unchanging.

original: skad cig ma ni rang bzhin du grub pas sangs rgyas kun skad cig gcig la rdzogs sangs rgyas pa'i phyir 'bras bu grub pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni rang bzhin du grub pas sangs rgyas kun skad cig gcig la rdzogs sangs rgyas pa'i phyir 'bras bu grub pa'o //
translated: Since a moment is established as the nature, the result is established because all buddhas are perfectly enlightened in a single moment.

original: 'o na 'bras bu ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Well, what is the result like?🔽The bodyless body, the supreme body,

original: lus med lus te lus kyi mchog / lus kyi mtha' ni kun du ston //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus med lus te lus kyi mchog / lus kyi mtha' ni kun du ston // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the end of the body is fully revealed.

original: de la chos sku dang gzugs sku ste 'bras bu mthar thug rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos sku dang gzugs sku ste 'bras bu mthar thug rtogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the dharmakāya and the rūpakāya are the ultimate result.

original: de bas chos sku ni lus kyi mthar thug ste /
analyzed: de bas chos sku ni lus kyi mthar thug ste /
translated: The dharmakāya is the ultimate body.

original: de rtogs par byed pa ni shes rab phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: de rtogs par byed pa ni shes rab phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: The one who realizes that is unmistaken wisdom.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: That is the Bhagavān.

original: 'o na stong pa nyid skad cig thabs dang bral bas gzhan don ji ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na stong pa nyid skad cig thabs dang bral bas gzhan don ji ltar byed ce na /
translated: Well, since emptiness is momentary and devoid of method, how does it benefit others?

original: gzugs rnams sna tshogs kun du ston //
analyzed: gzugs rnams sna tshogs kun du ston //
translated: It displays various forms.

original: zhe'o // 'o na de la gzugs sna tshogs mos pa bzhin du 'thad dam zhe na /
analyzed: zhe'o // 'o na de la gzugs sna tshogs mos pa bzhin du 'thad dam zhe na /
translated: “But is it tenable that it is like the various forms in a painting?”

original: nor bu chen po rin chen tog / ces bya bas so //
analyzed: nor bu chen po rin chen tog / ces bya bas so //
translated: The great jewel is Ratnacūḍa.

original: 'jig rten zhes byas gar ma la //🔽rdzu 'phrul zhes byas glu ma la //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes byas gar ma la // rdzu 'phrul zhes byas glu ma la //
translated: “World” is the dancer.🔽“Miracle” is the singer.

original: de nyid ces byas phreng ba ma //
analyzed: de nyid ces byas phreng ba ma //
translated: “Reality” is the garland-bearer.

original: dran pa zhes byas sgeg ma'o //
analyzed: dran pa zhes byas sgeg ma'o //
translated: “Recollection” is the flirt.

original: byang chub ces byas spos me ma //
analyzed: byang chub ces byas spos me ma //
translated: “Enlightenment” is the incense-bearer.

original: de bzhin zhes byas dri chab ma //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes byas dri chab ma //
translated: “Thus” is the perfume-bearer.

original: lam gyi zhes byas me tog ma //
analyzed: lam gyi zhes byas me tog ma //
translated: “Path” is the flower-bearer.

original: yang dag ces byas mar me ma'o //
analyzed: yang dag ces byas mar me ma'o //
translated: “Correct” is the lamp-bearer.

original: yid du 'ong dang rin chen zla //
analyzed: yid du 'ong dang rin chen zla //
translated: “Delightful” is the jewel-moon.

original: shugs can dang ni gsal bar byed //
analyzed: shugs can dang ni gsal bar byed //
translated: “Powerful” is the clarifier.

original: dga' ba'i dbang phyug gtsug phud 'od //
analyzed: dga' ba'i dbang phyug gtsug phud 'od //
translated: “Lord of joy” is the crest-light.

original: 'jigs pa bral dang yon tan snying //
analyzed: 'jigs pa bral dang yon tan snying //
translated: “Free from fear” is the heart of virtue.

original: dri med grags dang gzi brjid gzhi //
analyzed: dri med grags dang gzi brjid gzhi //
translated: “Pure fame” is the basis of splendor.

original: gdung ba grags dang lha gnas pa //
analyzed: gdung ba grags dang lha gnas pa //
translated: “Famous grief” is the abode of gods.

original: legs par mnyam dang rin chen sku //
analyzed: legs par mnyam dang rin chen sku //
translated: “Well-balanced” is the jewel body.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung dang sangs rgyas stobs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung dang sangs rgyas stobs //
translated: “Buddha-appearance” is the strength of the Buddha.

original: rin chen khyab dang grong khyer mthong //
analyzed: rin chen khyab dang grong khyer mthong //
translated: Ratnâvabhâsa, Nagara-darśin,

original: blo gros 'od dang 'jig rten 'od //
analyzed: blo gros 'od dang 'jig rten 'od //
